posts.name: Belle Isle Seafood
posts.note: Local seafood, including chowder and lobster rolls, in a spare, industrial space with inlet views. I ordered their fried Seafood Combo which had fried fish, shrimp, scallops, and I think clams along with French fries and cole slaw. No one can eat all the food you get by themselves. I'm glad I had help finishing it off.

posts.name: Blunch
posts.note: The Blunch breakfast and lunch counter is turning out hearty pressed sandwiches and chocolate chip cookies until late.

posts.name: Maria's Pastry Shop
posts.note: Unassuming Italian baker is offering acclaimed sweets such as cannoli, torrone, and marzipan.

posts.name: Mike's Pastry
posts.note: Renowned Italian bake shop is providing cannoli in multiple flavors, gelati, and biscotti since 1946. Mike's has some of the best cannoli I have ever had. On top of that, they are huge.
posts.cptn: Chocolate mouse with chocolate chip cannoli and a ricotta cannoli from Mike!s Pastry in Boston's North End.

posts.name: Salumeria Italiana
posts.note: Salumeria Italiana is a quaint fixture selling a range of Italian groceries, including meats, cheeses, pasta, and sauces. They supposedly have the best head cheese/Coppa di Testa in the country.

posts.name: Veggie Galaxy
posts.note: An imaginative twist on an old-school diner specializing in from-scratch vegan and vegetarian options. I ordered the Pearl Street Redhead Omelette (Portobellos, Caramelized Onion, Feta, Roasted Red Pepper Sauce) and don't forget to ask for their home-made hot sauce it's got the perfect amount of heat and spice for flavor.
